text: Martín de Espinosa y Monzó (1614–1676) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Comayagua (1672–1676). (in Latin) ==Biography== Martín de Espinosa y Monzó was born in Valladolid, México in 1614. On 12 September 1672, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Clement X as Bishop of Comayagua. In 1673, he was consecrated bishop by Francisco Antonio Sarmiento de Luna y Enríquez, Bishop of Michoacán. He served as Bishop of Comayagua until his death in 1676. ==References== ==External links and additional sources== * (for Chronology of Bishops) * (for Chronology of Bishops) Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Clement X Category:1614 births Category:1676 deaths
title: Martín de Espinosa y Monzón
